required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: iBAILA - Investigating Brains & Activity to Improve Latino Aging
clinical_study.official_title: iBAILA - Investigating Brains & Activity to Improve Latino Aging

brief_summary.textblock: Examine the impact of the BAILAMOS (TM) dance program on lifestyle physical activity

detailed_description.textblock: Examine the impact of the BAILAMOS (TM) dance program on lifestyle physical activity (PA). Hypothesis 1: Intervention group will demonstrate greater improvement in Lifestyle PA than controls. 2) Test the impact of BAILAMOS (TM) on cognitive function and quality of life. Hypothesis 2: Intervention group will demonstrate greater improvement in cognitive function and quality of life than controls. 3) Test the impact of BAILAMOS (TM) on brain network functional connectivity. Hypothesis 3: Intervention group will demonstrate enhanced Default Mode Network (DMN), Executive Network (EN), and sensorimotor network connectivity vis a vis controls.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Random assignment to intervention (BAILAMOS program) or control

primary_outcome.measure: Community Healthy Activities Model Program for Seniors (CHAMPS) Physical Activity Questionnaire for Older Adults
primary_outcome.description: To measure weekly frequency and duration of physical activity (Stewart et al., 2001)

Measured through a wrist-worn accelerometer (ActiGraph Model GT3X). Steps converted to light and moderate physical activity cut points specific to older adults (Miller, Strath, Swartz, & Cashin, 2010).

secondary_outcome.measure: Trail Making Test parts A and B
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of executive function (Adjutant General's Office 1944)
Measure of executive function (Wilson et al. 2005)

secondary_outcome.measure: Stroop C (color task) of the Stroop Neuropsychological Screening Test
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of executive function (Wilson et al. 2005; Trenerry et al. 1989)

secondary_outcome.measure: Stroop C-W (color-word task) of the Stroop Neuropsychological Screening Test
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of executive function (Wilson et al. 2005; Trenerry et al. 1989)
Measure of executive function (Welsh et al. 1994)
Measure of executive function (Smith 1982)
Measure of working memory (Wechsler 1987)
Measure of working memory (Cooper et al. 1991; Wilson et al. 2005)
Measure of episodic memory (Wechsler 1987)
Measure of episodic memory (Wechsler 1987)

secondary_outcome.measure: Cerebral functional connectivity - Default mode network
secondary_outcome.description: Functional connectomes were generated using the resting state functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) toolbox, CONN (http://www.nitrc.org/projects/conn)
Functional connectomes were generated using the resting state functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) toolbox, CONN (http://www.nitrc.org/projects/conn)
Functional connectomes were generated using the resting state functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) toolbox, CONN (http://www.nitrc.org/projects/conn)

arm_group.description: BAILAMOS© includes a 4-month, twice-weekly dance program. The PI and a professional dance instructor co-developed an extensive BAILAMOS© Dance Manual and class-by-class schedule.
Randomized to wait list, received BAILAMOS© program after data collection.

intervention.description: BAILAMOS© includes a 4-month, twice-weekly dance program. The PI and a professional dance instructor co-developed an extensive BAILAMOS© Dance Manual and class-by-class schedule.
